title: Re: When it's done
content:
I think I found like almost every secret there is to be found in these movies...

Useful tip: download the swf. Get standalone Flash Player. Use the following keys to frame-by-frame navigate trough the flash animation:
- ctrl+left = one frame back
- ctrl+right = one frame forward
- ctrl+enter = play

You can also resize the window vertically to get... SECRET BONUS FOOTAGE! most of the time. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

I love these secrets, I really do. Right now I'm thinking about the kill-a-puppy show in Up Skit Creek 2. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] ___________________
DaVince, Yet Another Amateur Game Creator! :P

title: Re: It's done
content:
Maybe the StrifeToons universe, being inside a magical computergame dimension and all, is subject to leakages between imagination and reality. Because Duke pretended that the burgerlectric forcefield was real, it became real inside Marine's mind*, and then some kind of uncertainty law kicked in and made it real outside of his mind as well.

Or maybe the Imp overheard them and he believed Duke so much that he kinda got hypnotised into thinking it was real - placebo effect.



*if, indeed, he has one----------

title: Re: It's done
content:
I was experimenting with the Earth's weak burgerlectric field (which is generated by orbiting onions above the atmosphere) recently. Apparently, if you pass a burgermagnet through the force field at right angles to the lines of burgerlectric flux, it generates burgers.
However, the Earth's burgerlectric field is so weak that the burgers are too small to be useful, and they disintegrate quickly.
It is hypothesised that there are "burgergalaxies" where the onion density is such that huge burgerlectric and burgermagnetic fields exist, generating vast quantities of burgers. Some scientists have postulated that burger-based life forms may exist in such galaxies, and this has given rise to debates as to what kind of condiments their internal fluids are composed of-

dear god what am i rambling about now [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img] ----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!

title: Re: It's done
content:
Indeed. Recent experiments with MCKFC magnets [Special burgerlectrocondometic magnets capable of generating much more powerful burgerlectric fields then are avalible naturally. These high burgerlectric fields have been found to have negative effects on mice exposed to them, [including weight gain and lethargy]

Recently there have been detected Burgars; rotation burgon stars composed of very dense matter, [so highly compressed that the individual burgers and fries of burgonic matter have been compressed into one giant mass] that are rapidly rotating and emitting dual radioburgonic beams.

[Beat THAT for a rant Mr Smart Alec]Szevvy Forever!
And Spleen never!

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.jpg[/img]
